tmt.corilla package¶

Submodules¶

tmt.corilla.api module¶

class tmt.corilla.api.Corilla(args)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for corilla interface.

apply()[source]¶

Apply calculated statistics in order to correct illumination artifacts.

static process_cli_commands(args, subparser)[source]¶

Initialize Corilla class with parsed command line arguments.

Parameters:
  • args (Namespace) – arguments parsed by command line interface
  • subparser (argparse.ArgumentParser) –
run()[source]¶

Run calculation of online statistics and write results to HDF5 file.

submit()[source]¶

Submit jobs for shift calculation.

In contrast to other routines, submission doesn’t require joblist!

tmt.corilla.stats module¶

class tmt.corilla.stats.OnlineStatistics(dims)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for calculating online statistics based on Welford’s method:

B. P. Welford (1962). “Note on a method for calculating corrected sums of squares and products”. Technometrics 4(3):419-420.

Code adapted from Wikipedia article “Algorithms for calculating variance”. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithms_for_calculating_variance#Online_algorithm

std¶
Returns:standard deviation
Return type:numpy.ndarray[float]
update(x, log_transform=True)[source]¶

Update statistics with new matrix.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray[float]) – new matrix
  • log_transform (bool, optional) – log10 transform matrix (defaults to True)
var¶
Returns:variance
Return type:numpy.ndarray[float]
